Question: Where compiled code will be stored if not in class file: :Recently I came across a query while reading THE STRUCTURE OF THE JAVA VIRTUAL MACHINEOn page no-5 ch. 2,Compiled code to be executed by the Java Virtual Machine is  represented using a hardware- and operating system-independent binary  format, typically (but not necessarily) stored in a file, known as the  class file format.That bracket But not necessarily is the reason.Question is, In which case compiled code will not be stored in class file ? and if it will not be stored in class file, then where and how ?Edit : Please note that question is not about ClassLoader.
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer: <<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: PrintWriter.write(String s)
<<<explanation>>>: PrintWriter.write(String s) writes a string to the stream.

A: I'm not sure what you mean by "class file" but I'll assume you mean the class file format.
The class file format is a binary format, and it is not stored in a file.  It is stored in a byte array in memory.  The JVM will load the class file into memory and then execute it.
